column4: hi, i'm using rtorrent and got this. can anyone tell me what it means?
http://pastebin.com/m61b1f15e
A segmentation fault is almost always caused by broken software. This being a torrent client I would assume a memory buffer is not being properly checked.
so should i recompile or somethhing?
If possible I would recomend trying an older version, another client or (perhaps first) download the torrent from another source.
I would recomend using the packaged version of rtorrent.
it doesnt have xml-rpc enabled
are you using a stable or unstable source tarball?
Are you using optimisation flags?
stable as far as i now
no idea of optimisation flags. i followed the install tutorial
Did you pass something like -O3 to the make command?
...or configure
no
yes
configure
Where did you find this install tutorial?
./configure with c++ enabled or something allong those lines
http://www.wtorrent-project.org/trac/wiki/wTorrentInstall
You're using the svn-version (read: development version) of rtorrent. Breakage is to be expected. Try getting a stable tarball.
aha
thanks, i'll get to it
